One local deminer working for an INGO was kidnapped and killed by anti-government elements.
Two INGO workers were killed when a roadside IED detonated.
One INGO worker was reportedly killed in anÊinter-clan dispute.
A local health worker was shot and injured by unidentified gunmen when she was on her way home.
Two local INGO staff members were killed when a roadside IED targeting the INGO vehicle was detonated. One civilian was also killed.

One senior-ranking INGO staff member was abducted byÊunidentified gunmen as he was returning from a school where he was providing services. ÊUPDATE: The staff member has been located inÊGulran district of Herat province, and Afghan officials are working with district elders to try to secure his release. ÊTwelve people have been arrested in connection to his kidnapping. ÊThe INGO has suspended services in Afghanistan.
Two NGO workers, while working on a road construction project, were abducted by unknown armed individuals. ÊThree other staff members were also robbed of their mobile phones.
An ambulance driver for the Libyan Red Crescent Society was killed in a targeted attack.

TheÊhead of the ICRC mission in Misrata, while leaving a meeting and walking to his vehicle, was shot and killed when masked gunmen in a car with tinted windows opened fire. ÊThe staff member later died in a nearby hospital.
One INGO national staff member was shot and wounded by an armed man, who proceeded to steal his motorbike.
One INGO deminer was shot and injured. It remains unclear if this was an intentional shooting or a stray bullet.Ê

column7: Muhammad Agha District, Aynak Copper Mine Field area
column32: Eight NGO deminers were killed and three others injured when anti-government elements attacked a minefield.
One driver transporting water for an NGO project was abducted by five anti-government elements. Ê
One INGO worker was injured when Sudan's air force bombed and partially deestroyed the INGO hospital.Ê

Two INGO national staff members and one local UN consultant were abducted while traveling to Kutum. ÊA third INGO staffer, the driver, was also abducted but later released. ÊThe vehicle was later abandoned. ÊUPDATE: The two INGO staff and the UN consultant were released on 19 July 2014.

Four INGO local personnel and one local contractor were abducted by unknown gunmen. ÊFourteen staff members were initially abducted, but nine were released after negotiations. ÊUPDATE: Two more INGO staff were released on 2 July 2014.
One pregnant NGO staff member was assaulted and injured by a male IDP patient. ÊShe was hospitalized for further treatment.Ê
One deminer was found dead with gunshot wounds. ÊThe circumstances leading to his death remain unclear.Ê

One female INGO staff member, while exercising at a cricket club, was attacked by an unknown man, who broke her arm and attempted to drag her to an overgrown area. ÊThe staff member was able to scream, at which point the assailant left as others came to help her.Ê
One UN international staff member was abducted by gunmen on a Land Cruiser. ÊUPDATE: he was released on 25 July 2014.
Six deminers were killed and one wounded when anti-government elements attacked the demining operation site. ÊOne person is also missing.

Two INGO staff were killed, one injured, and three abducted by armed men; the abducted individuals have since been released. ÊThe INGO convoy was on its way to its operations site when the attack occurred. ÊFour local police who were escorting the convoy were also killed.

One UN agency contractor was killed in an attack by Al-Shabaab on a government forces vehicle. The victim was reportedly connected with the government and was not targeted for his capacity as an aid agency contractor.

column32: Four INGO national staff members returning from a project visit were abducted by anti-government elements at an illegal checkpoint. ÊUPDATE: twoÊof the four INGO national staff members were released on 20 July and 21 July 2014; the other two remain unaccounted for.Ê
One UN worker was killed due to an air strike. ÊThe attack also killed her husband and daughter (not counted in database).
One UN worker was killed while fleeing from fighting inÊShejaiya district. ÊTen members of her family (not counted in database) were also killed in the attack.Ê
One UN worker was killed during an air strike as he was on his way home.
Two international aid workers, while in a taxi on the way to their office, were killed by gunmen on a motorcycle.
Two INGO staff members were killed by anti-government elements. ÊCivilians and Afghan government and military personnel were also killed in the attack.
OneÊPalestine Red Crescent Society volunteer was killed and three others wounded when their ambulance (clearly marked with the emblem of the Red Crescent society) was targeted in Beit Hanoun.
OneÊPalestine Red Crescent Society volunteer was shot and killed.
One national INGO staff member was seriously injured when a car bomb exploded close to a busy market. ÊThe staff member died soon after arriving at the hospital.
Two female international aid workers were kidnapped by armed men. No further information is available.
One UN guard was killed during an air strike in Rafah in southern Gaza.Ê
One INGO worker was pulled out of the INGO vehicle and shot and killed, allegedly by theÊMabanese Defense Forces. ÊIt appears that the killing was related to the individual's ethnicity.Ê

Two local INGO staff members were dragged out of their vehicle and shot and killed by the Mabanese Defense Forces. ÊIt appears that the killing was ethnically motivated. A third passenger was also shot and killed (not counted here).
One INGO staff member was killed by the Mabanese Defense Forces at his home. ÊIt appears that the killing was ethnically motivated.
A national contractor of an INGO was killed by individuals who are suspected to be part of the LRA. ÊHis three children (not counted here) were also abducted.
One NGO ambulance driver was abducted. ÊHe was released on 31 AugustÊfollowing negotiation by community elders and a ransom payment.
Five ICRC staff members were abducted by a local armed group while traveling to deliver aid in Herat province. ÊUPDATE: All 5 were released unharmed on 20 August.Ê

column7: Mohammad Agha District, Ab Bazak Area
column32: Three local employees of a demining NGO were abducted by anti-government elements. The vehicles have been recovered, but no information concerning the abductees.
Three female teachers and one driver working for a local NGO were killed when their vehicle struck an IED. ÊTwo children were also killed in the blast.
One local Red Cross worker was killed by a bullet while trying to evacuate casualties during violent demonstrations in front of the MINUSCA headquarters in Bangui.
Three INGO national staff members were abducted by unknown men. ÊThey were released unhurt two days later, on 26 August.Ê

Two national INGO doctors were abductedÊby individuals suspected to be part of theÊDemocratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR). ÊThey were released the following day after family members reportedly paid a ransom.Ê
Two guards on duty at an INGO health center were abducted by two armed men who broke in and also stole some property. ÊThe two guards were released the next day. Ê
A local NGO senior staff member was shot and killed while resisting a kidnap attempt.Ê
One ICRC-contracted driver was shot and wounded when the convoy he was traveling with was robbed by armed men.Ê

One national UN staff member was injured by armed robbers when returning home with his wife. ÊThe UN staff member is in stable condition at the hospital. ÊIt is suspected that the robbers were members of the Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of CongoÊ(FARDC).
A driver, who was driving as part of an INGO humanitarian convoy, was wounded when an armed militia attacked.
One INGO staff member was abducted outside his home and killed. ÊIt appears to have been a personal matter, and not related to his employment with the INGO.
One UN staff member was abductedÊon the Damascus-Aleppo Road. Ê
One UN staff member was assaulted by SPLA soldiers and required medical treatment. ÊAnother UN staff member was also assaulted, but seems to have been unhurt.

One INGO staff member, along with seven other individuals (government officials and journalists), was killed in a mob attack. ÊThe group was part of an Ebola education team. ÊIt appears that the community members attacked because they believed that health workers were spreading the disease.Ê
One INGO national staff member was abducted by anti-government elements at the INGO demining site. Ê
Seven INGO staff members were wounded by the explosion of a grenade, which detonated while they were cleaning a ditch.Ê
Six NGO contractors were abducted by anti-government elements. ÊThey were released the following day through the mediation of tribal elders.Ê
One ICRC worker was killed when a shell landed near the office.
One UN polio worker was killed in an IED explosion. Two others (not counted) were also killed in the attack.
One national UN staff member was kidnapped atÊgunpoint from Malakal airport by eight armed men. Ê
One INGO international staff member was injured when two individuals on a boda boda stole her purse. ÊThe staff member was hospitalized but released soon thereafter.
One INGO driver was carjacked and beaten by three armed men. ÊHe suffered injuries to his face and arm. ÊThe attack occured in the evening.
